intro: Cacalia frondosa, commonly known as the fronded bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, where it thrives in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. The plant features hairy, basal leaves that are often lobed or divided, and its flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in clusters at the tips of stems. Cacalia frondosa is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. It is a perennial herb that prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade.
